result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael G Hill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).
  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Letter from defendant, received and filed.

Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment 973.195, Wis. Stats, filed and distributed. tk 
The petition for sentence adjustment is denied because it is not in the public interest.
REASONS: The defendant's program certifications are commendable and important for purposes of his
successful rehabilitation; however, the court finds that the full duration of initial confinement time imposed by
Judge Dugan is necessary to punish and deter the defendant for his crime. Furthermore, the conduct reports,
including the major violation from August 8, 2017, cast significant doubt upon the likelihood of the defendant's
success on extended supervision and demonstrate that he is not an appropriate candiate for the extraordinary
remedy of a sentence adjustment.
Paper copy mailed to defendant and to the state.
Count one.  (Return Address:  Michael Hill #621289, Racine Correctional Institution, P.O. Box 900, Sturtevant, WI  53177).

Defendant Michael G Hill in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Defendant Michael G Hill in custody.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Presentence Investigation reviewed.  Additions and corrections not made.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by Christopher H. and Sue Hl
AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 9 YEARS  consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 177 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS.  Conditions of extended supervision:
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
*Sex offender assessment and comply with recommended treatment
*Random urine screens.
*No drugs.
*No contact with Katherine C.
*Seek and maintain fulltime employment
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy
*Vocational/educational training
*Register as a sex offender
*No unsupervised contact with children under the age of 18 except for the defendant's biological children

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 10 YEARS, consecutive to Count 1 and any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served.; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is  5 YEARS with the following conditions:
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
*Sex offender assessment and comply with recommended treatment
*Random urine screens.
*No drugs.
*No contact with Katherine C.
*Seek and maintain fulltime employment
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy
*Vocational/educational training
*Register as a sex offender
*No unsupervised contact with children under the age of 18 except for the defendant's biological children
The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 5 years CONSECUTIVE to count 1 and any other sentence with the following conditions:
*Defendant to serve 12 months in the House of Correction.  No good time credit.  Court stayed sentence to be used as sanctions.  Court ordered defendant to serve 30 days STRAIGHT time for 1st violation; 60 days STRAIGHT time for 2nd violation; balance as STRAIGHT time for 3rd violation.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
*Sex offender assessment and comply with recommended treatment
*Random urine screens.
*No drugs.
*No contact with Katherine C.
*Seek and maintain fulltime employment
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy
*Vocational/educational training
*Register as a sex offender
*No unsupervised contact with children under the age of 18 except for the defendant's biological children

AS TO EACH COUNT:
Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and imposed mandatory surcharges.
Defendant to pay DNA SURCHARGES and all other costs and any other surcharges during probation and/or by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release from extended supervision or successful completion of probation.

Court informed defendant he is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Court ordered defendant remanded into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Office.

Filed,
-Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
-Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief;

Attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood in court, defendant Michael G Hill not in court, in custody.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court in trial.  Defense needs more time to get sentencing memorandum completed.  Case adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 10.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.

On motion of the State, Court ordered presentence investigation. Order for presentence investigation filed; copy to Probation Dept.  
Case adjourned to 8-19-2014 at 8:30 a.m. for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 10.

Attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood in court, defendant Michael G Hill not in court, in custody.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Joint motion to adourn.  Case adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 10.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Calendar call scheduled for August 15, 2014 at 05:00 pm.

AS TO AMENDED CHARGES:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as AMENDED and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess firearms.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
